term.title: amplification reaction

item.text: A reaction which replaces the conventional reaction used in a particular determination so that a more favourable measurement can be made. The sequence can be repeated to provide a further favourable increase in measurement.

sources.item: PAC, 1982, 54, 2553. 'Recommendations on use of the term amplification reactions' on page 2554 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac198254122553)
